comments.body: Good idea, thank you for adding this.

Should this be collection maintainers now? I'm not actually sure how we handle collection maintainers - my guess is the collection makes its own rules?
```suggestion
* :ref:`Collection maintainers <maintainers>`: Collection maintainers own specific collections and have commit access to them. Each collection can set its own rules for contributions.
```
I can see community folks in BOTMETA.yml. @gundalow do you have any info if they still can `shipit` for automerge?
Maintainers listed in BOTMETA.yml can use `shipit` to merge via the bot.

@gundalow thanks for clarifying!

So, according to what @gundalow wrote, @acozine this is still relevant for ansible-core. I'll add what you're suggesting a bit below without removing the part about the module maintainers.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +47,51 @@=============
* Core committers: Fine to do pull requests for most things, but we should have a timebox. Hanging pull requests may merge on the judgement of these developers.
* :ref:`Module maintainers <maintainers>`: Module maintainers own specific modules and have indirect commit access through the current module pull request mechanisms.
* :ref:`Collection maintainers <maintainers>`: Collection maintainers own specific collections and have commit access to them. Each collection can set its own rules for contributions.
